From: Colin Green <colin.green1@...>

Hi Peter,


On 18 December 2017 at 21:01, Peter Chervenski spookey@... [neat]
<neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
>
> but I'm not sure yet how crossover and compatibility distance will work.

Sounds like they're suggesting that the fitness space in high D may
not be as deceptive as we had feared, and therefore methods to
overcome that deceptiveness (e.g. speciation) may not be entirely
necessary. Speciation is about searching in multiple regions on the
basis that some of those regions will get you stuck if you just follow
the gradient (to a local minima).

In less deceptive fitness landscapes you can start from anywhere and
follow the gradient to the global maximum (or good enough), so you may
no longer need multiple species and thus a distance metric either.

Colin
